attributes.comment:
We are in the process of adopting from the P.R. China and have learned that the
USCIS is discussing rate increases for the I-600A as well as for fingerprints
(biometrics). Due to the increasing wait for child referral from China we will
likely need to reapply for the I-600A as well as our fingerprints. Having to
reapply already adds extra financial burden to the adoption process and the rate
increase would only make ours, and many others, adoptions that much more
difficult. We ask that you please keep the rates as they are so as to not add
increased financial burden to adoptive families.

Thank-you
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
